title: meser#
author: meser#
content: Following the forum rules is important for various of reasons. First of all, it helps to create a positive and respectful community where members can have constructive discussions. When everyone follows the rules, it makes the forum a more enjoyable and welcoming place for everyone.¬† This can help to make the forum a more valuable resource for everyone who uses it. Finally, not following the rules can result in consequences such as warnings or bans, so it's always in your best interest to follow them whether be newbie or legendary it doesn't matter.For this reason, this topic was created to inform the new members about the forum rules in a different way. It is also intended to remind those who have been members for a long time. I hope you like it Some questions have 2 choices and some of them 4 choices. Don't be afraid to make mistakes, mistakes don't take away the true answers in this test, go as far as you can, you are the judge here you can't deceive yourself  1) If you were to write an answer to the quote below, what would it be?Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on October 17, 2022, 09:03:54 AMIs anyone having such issues? I am having difficulty browsing around the pages.IMAGEMenus are not clearly loading, the text box tool icons are not loading, index page board icons are not loading, left and right icons (last post) on the topic list for boards are not loading.I tried to clear cache with possible everything. Ctrl+Shift+R, Ctrl+F5. Cleared my browsing history. But nothing is working. It seems something wrong on the server side, CSS messed up or something.a) Nob) -1c) I haven't faced with such a problem. However, there may be a problem with your internet connection. Can you turn the modem off and on?d) LOL2) Do you have any problems for opening the following thread?QuoteBitcoin Forum > Economy > Economics > Start new topicSubject: How digital moneys effect our future?Message:I did a deep research on this subject and wanted to share the results with you. In my opinion, the effects of digital currencies on our lives are as follows:In simple terms, digital money can be defined as a form of currency that uses computer networks to make payments. Breathless media coverage of the future potential of cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin has made digital money a hot topic.One of the main differences between digital money and physical currency, such as cash, is that digital money lacks any identifying features that make it unique. If you take a glance at any bank notes you might have sitting in source:theconversation. com/beyond-just-cryptocurrencies-digital-money-has-changed-how-we-live-181681 your wallet or purse, you will quickly notice that each note has a serial number ‚Äî a unique string of letters and numbers that marks the uniqueness of that bill.But as we know, digital objects, such as songs or images, are easily reproducible infinitely on the internet. What prevents us from reproducing the digital money in our bank accounts so easily?Most of us have been using digital money all along. It is not the digital nature of cryptocurrencies that differentiate them from digital money, but rather how they ensure the ownership of digital property that mark them as transformational.a) Nope, Its fine! -o- b) Yeap there is a big problem hereee!3) You sat all night and prepared a very good topic. But a few hours passed and no comments or merits. What do you do?a) I'll bump the thread immediately!b) I would write a message about how hard I worked for this topic and ask why nobody interest.c) I would wait at least 24 hours to draw attention to the thread again.d) I would send dozens of messages to people who are active in the forum to make the thread active via private message.4) What's wrong with this friend?Quote from: newbiestto memberBitcoin Forum > Other > Beginners & Help > Start new topicSubject: I need some help!Message:Hello everyone, I can not speak English. So I will write my question in Turkish.--Beni telefonla arayƒ±p kendisini Satoshi Nakamoto olarak tanƒ±tan birisi benden 1000$ g√∂ndermemi istedi √ßok dardaymƒ±≈ü ve bu forumda kime sorsam onu tanƒ±yacaƒüƒ±nƒ± s√∂yledi. Kendisine 1000$ g√∂nderdim ve ula≈üamƒ±yorum. Rica etsem tanƒ±yormu≈üsunuz ya bir ula≈ü≈üanƒ±zda benim 1000$ ne olmu≈ü bir haber verseniz Warning: Never believe anyone who calls you on the phone and introduces himself as Satoshi Nakamoto and asks you to send money or send bitcoins or altcoins to an address.a) Believing the one who says I am Satoshib) Posting in the wrong place5) Let's talk a little about money  How about getting a price estimate for Ethereum?Quote from: newbiestto memberBitcoin Forum > Bitcoin > Bitcoin Discussion > Start new topicSubject: What about ETH's potential?Message:Novadays everyone talks about how bitcoin rise and fall but what about Ethereum haa??? Is Ethereum adopted why nobody talks about Ethereum! I believe it will reach 20K$ before Bitcoin hit 100K!!!a) Post -o- b) Need a review6) Let's say someone scam you by using malware or phishing and what will you do?a) I would threaten him with death!b) To offer partnership by saying that if you scammed me, you have capabilitiesc) I would open a thread in Reputation so others wouldn't get scammed.d) I would use his technique to get my losses back7) You have 5 invitations in a forum where you have been waiting for an invitation for a long time to become a member. Want to earn money by selling these invitations?a) Why not! -o- b) Are you crazy? I wont sell! 8 ) You have prepared a project and your goal is very high. How do you want to advertise?a) I organize giveawayb) I send the project's web page and its introduction to the forum members via private message.c) I'd coordinate a campaign by meeting with bounty managers.d) I'd advertise it on all local boards using google translate.9) Let's say you have more than one product and you think the more topics the more sales, right?a) Yeap -o- b)Nope!10) You wake up one morning and what is that? You are banned! What will you do?a) Open a new account and continue as if nothing happened!b) Opening a new account and disrespecting those who ban youc) This love is up to here I won't come back again!d) Opening a new account, creating thread on Meta section and defend yourself!If you had problems with this test, I suggest you take a look at these sources:Quote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM[1] - "Forum moderation policy" - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=20333.0[2] - "Marketplace rules and guidelines" - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=3629.0[3] - "Currency Exchange rules and guidelines" - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=594959.0[4] - "Do not post about altcoins here, use the correct sub-forums please." - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=401897.0[5] - "NEWBIE README" - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=177133.0[6] - "Giveaway threads are not allowed" - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=434310.0[7] - "Do not post off-topic replies" - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=14356.0[8] - "Advertising spam is not allowed" - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=718124.0[9] - "Ads in posts" - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=749961.0[10] - "Re: [Serious] Avatar Rules Discussion" - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1011789.msg10977206#msg10977206[11] - "Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQ" - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.010th QUESTIONQuote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM25. If you get banned (temporarily or permanently) and create a new account to continue posting / sending PMs, it's considered ban evasion. The only exception is creating a thread in Meta about your ban.If you are banned from the forum and you think you are innocent; All you have to do is create a new account just to post topics on Meta. If an account has been banned and you plan to open a new account and continue, remember that sooner or later you will be caught. Also, even if your disrespectful behavior is tolerated, remember that this forum and community is respectful and you may find yourself left out. Therefore if your account banned wrongly just wait for your request handled!Therefore, the correct answer is "D".And if you've come this far without any mistakes, congratulations my friend üëèüëèüëèüëè 9th QUESTIONQuote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM30. This includes (but is not limited to) domains, software keys and membership invitations. What's considered similar is up to the moderator handling the situation.16. Do not have more than one active sales topic in the Currency exchange board. [3]It may be profitable for you to highlight more than one product, but for the operation and system of this forum, similar content should be offered for sale on a single topic.¬† And don't forget you can have only one active sales topic in the Currency Exchange BoardGo to next question8th QUESTIONQuote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM15. No on-forum altcoin giveaways. [6][e]29. Sending unsolicited PMs, including but not limited to advertising and flood, is not allowed.27. Using automated translation tools to post translated content in Local boards is not allowed.You want to be successful, but the old ways are starting to get boring. For this reason; You can't get anywhere by sending promotional messages to members' private message boxes, opening a giveaway topic in the forum and using translation applications on local boards. Because these actions are prohibited in order to maintain the order of the forum. Also, be more rational otherwise the end of this road is gettin banned!Go to next question7th QUESTIONQuote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM20. There are restrictions when selling accounts and invites for invite-only sites. See https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=134779.0 [2][?]Being a member of sites that accept membership by invitation can be really challenging, even I have experienced this situation. People who are banned from these sites or who want to engage in any fraudulent activity continue to act by purchasing invitations. Apart from being restricted by the rule specified in the forum, if these people detected by moderators or admins you may banned too. All your efforts and reputation will gone in that situation.Go to next question6th QUESTIONQuote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM8. No threats to inflict bodily harm, death threats.Q: Why haven't you banned <insert scammer username here> who is an obvious scammer?A: Possible (or real, not for me to decide) scams are not moderated to prevent moderator abuse. If we start picking out which ones we call "scammers" and ban, we would make a lot of decisions based on biased opinions.6. No linking to phishing or malware, without a warning and a valid reason. [e]First of all, God save us from such people. Secondly death threats and using malware or sth is forbidden due to forum rules. If you try to scam using a phishing or malware, you will be banned sooner or later. The best thing you can do is to warn forum members by posting on reputation!Go to next question5th QUESTIONQuote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM14. All altcoin related discussion belong in the Alternate cryptocurrencies and its child boards. [3][4][e]If you want to open a topic about Ethereum or any other altcoin, the Bitcoin discussion board is not the right place Go to next question4th QUESTIONQuote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM9. Discussions in the main boards must be in english. All other language discussions should be posted in the appropriate Local board.It may be a problem for him to trust the person who says he is Satoshi, but this will not be binding on the forum rules. However, it is unacceptable to open a topic in a local language on the main board Go to next question3th QUESTIONQuote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM13. Bumps, "updates" are limited to once per 24 hours per thread. Bumping multiple threads at the same time is allowed if it's not annoying. [2][e]7. No begging. [5]29. Sending unsolicited PMs, including but not limited to advertising and flood, is not allowed.Almost all of us have experienced it. We have had messages or topics that we have been thinking about for hours. In fact, when we wake up, we look and there is neither a message nor a merit. However, we are not the decision maker here. Let me give an example, you may not want to send a message or merit to a topic that someone else has worked on, this is your decision. Likewise, it is the decision of the members to send a reply or merit to your messages and topics. Therefore, if you want to update the topic again in accordance with the forum rules, you should wait at least 24 hours, you should not abuse members via private messages and you should not beg by doing actions such as demagogy.Go to next question2th QUESTIONQuote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM33. Posting plagiarized content is not allowed.[e]So our trick question is here  If you look carefully, there is a space in a second paragraph. If you press and hold there you will see "Source: Link" the message is hidden. That means this user copy and paste this text from somewhere. The problem is he claimed at the beginning this is his research. However nowadays, many web sites add information with the name of the site in the copying action with some plugins in order to prevent plagiarism. This member didn't notice this, so how did you miss it Go to next question1th QUESTIONQuote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM1. No zero or low value, pointless or uninteresting posts or threads. [1][e]2. No off-topic posts.3. No trolling.Clearly worthless, off-topic and trolling posts are forbidden in the forum rules. However in some situation, messages such as +1 or -1 may be meaningful, but in this message clearly they aren't.Go to next questionSPECIAL THANKSI would like to thank our admins and moderators who have been keeping this forum organized for years. Secondly, a special thank you to our Global moderator @mprep for bringing these rules together. I would like to thank those who contributed to bringing these rules together, and everyone who translated these rules into the languages of the relevant local boards.I would also like to thank our hidden heroes who helped our moderators by using the report button.Finally, I would like to thank @BitcoinGirl.Club for their contribution as part of this forum. She was little bit offended in my last content, I hope we are fine now  You may also want to check out my other amusing content Find Your True Rank! - "A test thread where you can test your knowledge of the forum in an interactive way"Are you ready to solve different math puzzles? - "An entertaining puzzle series where you can test your math knowledge"Main Source: @mprep¬† ¬†-¬† Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQ

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.created_time: December 14, 2022, 09:25:53 PMLast edit: December 14, 2022, 10:03:56 PM by Upgrade00
comments.body: Many of the questions are general, forum trivia questions and not necessarily related to the forum rules or how to avoid breaking them.I scored 10/10, which doesn't mean much, cause I've been around here for a while.Newbies should have a go and see how familiar they are with forum rules.

comments.author: meser#
comments.body: Quote from: Upgrade00 on December 14, 2022, 09:25:53 PMMany of the questions are general, forum trivia questions and not necessarily related to the forum rules or how to avoid breaking them.I scored 10/10, which doesn't cause I e been around here for a while.Thousands of reports are sent every year. Many members are unwittingly breaking the rules here. It may be unnecessary for members with awareness like you, but with this topic, I tried to raise awareness by introducing these forum rules to new members in a functional way.¬† As long as there are people who are banned, we can say that not everyone can make 10/10  So I hope this thread will be useful to someone.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: meser# on December 14, 2022, 09:44:23 PMAs long as there are people who are banned, we can say that not everyone can make 10/10  So I hope this thread will be useful to someone. Wasn't knocking down your effot; it's a good initiative and would surely help many forum members come to the awareness of the rules and why it's important.I was a bit sleepy while typing, happens sometimes and the message doesn't come through as it was intended. Would love to see a challenge to know how may members TUI - Type under the influence. Not necessarily literally

She was little bit offended in my last content, I hope we are fine now  Come on bother, I was not offended at all, I was just having fun if you are talking about the response on your last last quiz. Sorry if you felt that way, we are cool. üòò#1. Everyone else can response except me LOL#2. Hilariousandco, mprep do you job.#3. F**k you all#4. MiningBuddy is gone. Hilariousandco, mprep do you job.#5. F**k shitcoin #6. Where the F**k is scam accusation board LOL#7. F**k it#8. I don't give a shit LOL#9. mprep is going to kick your ass#10. F**k the mod, I have CryptioS to help me

comments.author: Sandra_hakeem
comments.body: Well, I didn't wanna say anything In here ( for some reasons I'm uncertain about just yet) but it's cool.I love the effort, the creativity and lastly, the presentation... For sure, it deserves some accolades.. kudos dude. I'll still tell you that you've mixed up things seriously.... This are two different context in one topic, -- I'm not saying it ain't cool like that but, it doesn't commensurate properly -- yeah I know for sure that "knowing which responses to make each and everytime is imperative" .... Knowing the forum rules is too... This ain't no segregation, take note.I'll urge 'em rookies -- the ones we've got trooping in lately to please adhere to the rules -- that's what has kept everyone you've seen this far...Sandra üßë‚Äçü¶∞

comments.author: AliErkic
comments.body: Quote from: meser# on December 14, 2022, 08:45:05 PMQuote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM1. No zero or low value, pointless or uninteresting posts or threads. [1][e]2. No off-topic posts.3. No trolling.Clearly worthless, off-topic and trolling posts are forbidden in the forum rules. However in some situation, messages such as +1 or -1 may be meaningful, but in this message clearly they aren't.+1 or -1, where no additional insight is added is never useful, same like "Buy, buy, buy, it's good coin!", "congrats for winning, bro" or "very nice project, SIR" it's outright shitpost and should be deleted ASAP + if it's done again from same member in a new post, newly written after a previous post was already deleted = 7 day ban if account is wearing a paid signature. If in question, paid signature spam should be deleted.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: AliErkic on December 15, 2022, 03:50:38 AM+1 or -1, where no additional insight is added is never useful<snip>I don't visit many other non-crypto related forums anymore, but boy oh boy did that used to be a thing--and it probably is still a thing on discussion forums that allow it.¬† Goddamn is it annoying to have to scroll through dozens of posts like that, and I've just taken it for granted on bitcointalk that nobody is going to get away with just posting "+1" or those other useless phrases you mentioned, but it's thanks to the rules we have here that crap like that doesn't pollute threads even further.OP, I liked how you presented this in a kinda-sorta fun way.¬† Hopefully any newbies reading it will take all this information to heart, because it's spot-on.On a related note, I haven't seen many ban appeal threads lately.¬† I just noticed that; could it be that rules are being broken less?¬† My noodle will ponder that all night until the coffee is gone.

comments.author: digaran
comments.body: Op it's not 1th or 2th, should be 1st 2nd 3rd 4th 5th 6th so on, fix it before i lose my mind, thank you.

comments.author: Welsh
comments.body: Quote from: meser# on December 14, 2022, 09:44:23 PMThousands of reports are sent every year. Many members are unwittingly breaking the rules here. It may be unnecessary for members with awareness like you, but with this topic, I tried to raise awareness by introducing these forum rules to new members in a functional way.¬† As long as there are people who are banned, we can say that not everyone can make 10/10  So I hope this thread will be useful to someone. I like the effort, unfortunately a lot of the rule breakers aren't unintentionally breaking the rules, they just don't care. They're here for one thing only, and that's to make money. So, they probably haven't even looked at the rules, let alone attempt to do something like this. It's also probably important to outline that a lot of us probably break the rules unintentionally from time to time. For example, off topic posts are almost common place. I think every user does this from time to time.

comments.author: meser#
comments.body: Quote from: The Sceptical Chymist on December 15, 2022, 04:41:56 AMOP, I liked how you presented this in a kinda-sorta fun way.¬† Hopefully any newbies reading it will take all this information to heart, because it's spot-on.On a related note, I haven't seen many ban appeal threads lately.¬† I just noticed that; could it be that rules are being broken less?¬† My noodle will ponder that all night until the coffee is gone.Let's hope that members act are getting fit to rules because if its so this place will better than yesterday Quote from: Welsh on December 15, 2022, 09:10:11 PMI like the effort, unfortunately a lot of the rule breakers aren't unintentionally breaking the rules, they just don't care. They're here for one thing only, and that's to make money. So, they probably haven't even looked at the rules, let alone attempt to do something like this. It's also probably important to outline that a lot of us probably break the rules unintentionally from time to time. For example, off topic posts are almost common place. I think every user does this from time to time. I can say that I am glad that the number of people who really care is not small. Others will eventually find themselves left out by respectful members. -What they say, small actions will be news of big changes. Even if it has an effect on even one person out of 3.5 million members, it means that we have put another brick for tomorrow.

comments.body: For the record, I have always followed the forum rules!¬†  ~BCX~
